featured.text: Accused of neglecting this part of our education, my father still instituted a summer school for my brother and me.
As a result, health concerns have been neglected.

His summer course included ancient history, which Papa felt our schools neglected, and navigation, in which we first had a formal examination in the dining room, part of which consisted of tying several knots in a given time limit.

definition.zh_def: 忽視；不重視或不照顧某事物或某人。
definition.en_def: To fail to care for or pay attention to someone or something.
definition.example: She decided to neglect her studies and focus on her hobbies instead.
